questions.question: The science devoted to the study of the earth's surface and its interior is
Lithosphere is
choices: the upper part of the mantel.
composed of hard, solid (as opposed to softer, fluid) rock.

questions.question: Geologists call the liquid, molten rock nearest the earth's center the
Regions of crust sometimes collide. These collision zones are called
A process that moves large pieces of rock would be
Liquid rock flowing from active volcanoes is called
The worst volcanic disaster in U.S. history occurred at
choices: Mount St. Helens in Washington State.

questions.question: The specific point where an earthquake begins is called the
An earthquake reading of 6.8 on the Richter scale is ________ times more powerful than a reading of 5.8.
Earthquakes that occur on the ocean floor
Sodium chloride (table salt) in a water solution will dry to form crystals that we then identify
The interaction of physical and chemical processes that change rocks from one type to another is called the
Limestone would best be classified as a
A good, yet relatively inexpensive, low temperature conductor of electricity is
A major advantage of metallic minerals is that
choices: they are always inexpensive to extract.
the earth is constantly making more of them.

questions.question: Metal-mining waste material is called
Mineral resources
choices: are mostly concentrated in the U.S., Canada, Russia, South Africa, and Australia.
are distributed unevenly throughout the world.

questions.question: Given that metallic minerals are limited resources, depletion time
choices: never factors in new discoveries of the mineral.
is the time it takes to use up 80% of the reserves of a mineral at a given rate of use.
always factors in recycling and reuse.

questions.question: New technology(ies) that can be used to extract metals from low-grade ore include:
choices: solar furnaces that create higher temperatures for smelting the ore.
new chemicals that remove metals from ores more efficiently.
bacteria that can live in the ore, extracting/concentrating specific metals.

questions.question: Styrofoam has been found to be a suitable substitute for
choices: concrete when sprayed with ceramic as a building material.
steel and copper as pipe and conduit.
steel and aluminum in auto bodies.
